Class CivPlayer

java.lang.Object
CivPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CivPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class serves as a player in the game and stores current data. Player can be human and computer, and data includes each player's country, current gold, current units and their positions.
Author:
Anh Nguyen Phung, Hung Le Ba, Thu Tra, Peter Vo
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • addUnit

      public void addUnit​(CivCharacter character, int row, int col)
      Add a new unit to current player
      Parameters:
      character - the new character to be added
      row - the row position to be added on the board
      col - the column position to be added on the board

    • removeUnit

      Parameters:

    • updateUnit

      public void updateUnit​(CivCharacter character, int row, int col)
      Update a current unit's position
      Parameters:
      character - the current character to be updated
      row - new row position to be moved over to
      col - new column position to be moved over to
